title: FOIA Request – Police Funding & Surveillance Spending

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request copies of the following records related to the Flint Police Department:

Surveillance & Data Collection
 - The locations of all Flock Cameras and any associated data retention policies.
 - Any purchase orders, contracts, or policies regarding License Plate Readers (LPRs).
 - Copies of all records related to facial recognition technology, including vendors, contracts, and policies.
 - All records related to the use of social media monitoring tools, AI-powered online tracking, or digital surveillance of citizens.
 - Any records regarding Stingray (cell-site simulator) technology, including deployment logs, policies, and training materials.
 - All gunshot detection system (ShotSpotter) reports, including statistics on false positives and policies on police responses.
 - Any data-sharing agreements between Flint PD and state/federal agencies, including local Fusion Centers.

Crowd Control & Protest Surveillance
 - Records of drone surveillance at protests, public events, or general policing over the last five years.
 - Deployment logs for crowd control equipment (tear gas, rubber bullets, LRADs, etc.).
 - Any internal memos, training materials, or policies regarding identifying and disrupting protest organizers.

Budget & Equipment Acquisition
 - A full breakdown of grants, federal funding, and private donations received for police surveillance and riot control equipment.
 - A report on how funds from civil asset forfeiture have been spent in the last five years.
 - Any contracts with private surveillance companies (e.g., Palantir, Flock Safety, Clearview AI, Axon).


I request digital copies of these documents. If any part of this request is denied, please provide the specific legal exemption being cited.

I request a fee waiver as this information is in the public interest.

Please confirm receipt of this request and respond within 5 business days, as required by Michigan FOIA law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michigan Transparency
